Author: Captain_Jack#0015
Content: problem I see with the game theory of the fees and gas that use tokens...its counter intuitive to increase the price of the the thing in which I pay 'fees' ... using binance coin as an example...the price of the token increases and my fees go up....in this environment I don't want the price of the token to increase and if the price of thing provably increases, I'd be better off saving it than spending it.  This is similar to the daily kmd fee...or gas...or any type of usage based or rental fee.  I'm not complaining about the fee...I'm saying the game theory here seems to be weak...the more the price of kmd goes up the more I pay per day in fees.  It appears to me that this applies to all 'fee' systems that use the same 'store of value' token as the means of fee payment.  With a fixed payment amount for rent, the daily users (those paying rent) have only negative benefit to the 'store of value' increasing in cost or value.  Notice that the mining difficulty changes with market value...but the 'rent' does not.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this is why assetchain txfees are not denominated in KMD

Author: Captain_Jack#0015
Content: ahh...I didn't see that in the dev docs

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ETH suffers from this to a very large degree, but globally. ie. if a single dapp starts using up a lot of gas, the costs for all users go up

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: independent chains mean independent chains

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: LTC doesnt pay any BTC txfees

Author: Captain_Jack#0015
Content: I understood the DPoW fee is 365kmd/year?

Author: Captain_Jack#0015
Content: for asset chain?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and if you do 1000 tx or a million tx, the fee is the same

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so it is not an incremental cost, just a fixed cost of maintaining security for a chain

Author: Captain_Jack#0015
Content: understand

Author: Captain_Jack#0015
Content: Thats the tx fee...with KMD the only 'rent' from an asset chain is the the DPoW and Komodo dev fee correct?  This ultimately is way lower than these other options...still the game theory will push a behavior of save vs spend as the rent is denominated in kmd

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think you need to update your game theory

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if your chain wants to be secure then it pays for dPoW

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if it doesnt care, then it wont

Author: Captain_Jack#0015
Content: yes...I think I need to fully updated my understanding of the asset chain costs....

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that is the game theory and the price of KMD is secondary. its not like you will get multiple dPoW if the KMD price is low and half a dPoW if the price is high

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: other than dPoW, all assetchain costs are denominated in the assetchain coin

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not sure what is hard to understand about that

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: KMD price can be $1 or $100, the cost for normal assetchain tx is still in assetchain coins and nothing to do with KMD

Author: Captain_Jack#0015
Content: its like a child learning a new thing...sorry if this is disturbing to you...thanks for responding to my questions

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: now maybe if KMD price goes 100x, it will also raise the price of the assetchain coin...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but the assetchain creator has ways to get a percentage of block rewards or even all tx value

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: plus premine, so there are many ways to obtain a sustainable amount of assetchain coins

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and whether you want dPoW protection is only based on whether you want a secure chain or not, the cost of KMD does not affect the cost per assetchain tx

Author: Captain_Jack#0015
Content: fully get that...how the game theory affects the DPoW fee is what I was referring to...but you correctly point out that the majority of the 'fees' are tx fees and these are much better on kmd than others as the asset chains are truly independent.

Author: Captain_Jack#0015
Content: You also point out another benefit..that is the security of DPoW has a cost

Author: Captain_Jack#0015
Content: but the DPoW cost will increase at a fixed rate as KMD value goes up

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if a project cant afford $300 per year at todays price to secure their chain, it seems they are not serious about providing a secure chain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: even at 10x the price, it is $3000 per year, not exactly a large expenditure

Author: Captain_Jack#0015
Content: so DPoW costing is the game theory that seems counterproductive...it is valuable....and the current cost is much less expensive than other methods...its not the value I'm discussing...its the fact that as KMD becomes more valuable that cost will go up considerably?  100xKMD= asset chain DPoW cost 100X...is that a correct understanding?

Author: Captain_Jack#0015
Content: so if KMD does well, the asset chains will need to discontinue DPoW?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: when KMD is $100, the dPoW cost of $30,000 per year might be an issue. in such a case it would be possible to reduce the cost a bit with slower frequency

Author: Captain_Jack#0015
Content: ok..so my game theory is not 'broken' here?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but with KMD at $100, that means crypto bull market is back

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in which case the assetchain coins are worth a lot more

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so paying $30,000 wont be much of an issue

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a long term planning method would be to purchase 6000 KMD at current low prices

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then for 12 years the notarization fees are covered by the annual reward and another 20 years from the 6000

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so 30+ years of dPoW for 6000 KMD, just a bit more than $100 per year

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in such a scenario KMD at $1000 wont matter

Author: Captain_Jack#0015
Content: bull market for the winners.  Also this works for me now as I have quite a bit more that that...but for future devs wanting to use the eco system this might not be so easy

Author: Captain_Jack#0015
Content: I get it...to summarize..this fee is not fixed and can be adjusted as necassary

Content: yes, but dPoW cant be free

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and not all projects can afford it, but we will have a probono program for deserving projects that dont have funding

Content: i think you are imagining all sorts of problems where there isnt any
